MARVIS

  • View page source

marvis.utils

Utility functions and helper modules.

Resource Management

Robust resource management system for MARVIS with concurrent access support.

This module provides centralized, package-aware resource management that eliminates fragile path-guessing logic and provides consistent resource organization across different deployment environments.

Key features: - Package-aware path resolution using importlib.resources - Consistent dataset workspace isolation - Environment variable configuration support - Backward compatibility with existing code - Centralized config and metadata management - Unified dataset preparation with intelligent caching and checking - Thread-safe dataset registry with concurrent access support

The DatasetRegistry provides safe concurrent access through: - File locking with timeout and retry mechanisms - Atomic write operations using temporary files + rename - Distributed registry architecture with local registry files - Automatic merging of registry updates from multiple processes - Graceful degradation when registry is unavailable

Environment Variables for Registry Configuration: - MARVIS_REGISTRY_LOCK_TIMEOUT: Lock acquisition timeout in seconds (default: 10.0) - MARVIS_REGISTRY_RETRY_ATTEMPTS: Number of retry attempts (default: 3) - MARVIS_REGISTRY_SYNC_INTERVAL: Registry refresh interval in seconds (default: 30.0) - MARVIS_DISABLE_REGISTRY: Set to true to disable registry entirely (default: false)

The DatasetPreparer class provides a unified interface for dataset preparation that: - Checks if datasets are already prepared before re-downloading - Separates download and organization steps with intelligent caching - Provides consistent logging and error handling - Integrates with the dataset registry for tracking

Usage examples:

# Simple CIFAR preparation using convenience function train_paths, train_labels, test_paths, test_labels, class_names = prepare_cifar_dataset(cifar10)

# Custom dataset preparation using the DatasetPreparer resource_manager = get_resource_manager() success = resource_manager.dataset_preparer.prepare_dataset(

dataset_id=my_dataset, dataset_type=vision, check_function=my_check_function, download_function=my_download_function, organize_function=my_organize_function

)

# Registry management resource_manager.cleanup_registry(max_age_days=7) # Clean up old entries status = resource_manager.get_registry_status() # Get registry info

resolve_openml_identifiers(task_id: int | None = None, dataset_id: int | None = None, dataset_name: str | None = None) → Dict[str, Any][source]

Resolve OpenML identifiers to get complete mapping.

Given any one of task_id, dataset_id, or dataset_name, returns all three.

Parameters:

  • task_id OpenML task ID

  • dataset_id OpenML dataset ID

  • dataset_name Dataset name string

Returns:

task_id, dataset_id, dataset_name Returns None values for any that couldnt be resolved

Return type:

Dictionary with keys

class marvis.utils.resource_manager.DatasetPreparer(path_resolver: PathResolver, dataset_registry: DatasetRegistry | None = None, cache_manager: CacheManager | None = None)[source]

Unified dataset preparation with intelligent caching and checking.

__init__(path_resolver: PathResolver, dataset_registry: DatasetRegistry | None = None, cache_manager: CacheManager | None = None)[source]
prepare_dataset(dataset_id: str, dataset_type: str, check_function: callable, download_function: callable, organize_function: callable = None, force_redownload: bool = False, force_reorganize: bool = False, min_samples: int = 100) → bool[source]

Unified dataset preparation with intelligent caching.

Parameters:

  • dataset_id Unique identifier for the dataset

  • dataset_type Type of dataset (e.g., vision, audio, tabular)

  • check_function Function that returns True if dataset is ready

  • download_function Function that downloads/extracts the dataset

  • organize_function Optional function that organizes downloaded data

  • force_redownload Force re-download even if dataset exists

  • force_reorganize Force re-organization even if already organized

  • min_samples Minimum number of samples expected in prepared dataset

Returns:

True if dataset is ready, False otherwise

prepare_cifar_dataset(dataset_type: str = 'cifar10', force_redownload: bool = False) → tuple[source]

Prepare CIFAR-10 or CIFAR-100 dataset using unified management.

Parameters:

  • dataset_type cifar10 or cifar100

  • force_redownload Force re-download even if dataset exists

Returns:

Tuple of (train_paths, train_labels, test_paths, test_labels, class_names)

get_cached_color_mapping(dataset_id: str, unique_classes: list) → dict[source]

Get cached color mapping for a dataset, generating and caching if needed.

Parameters:

  • dataset_id Dataset identifier (e.g., task_id or dataset name)

  • unique_classes List of unique class labels

Returns:

  • class_to_color: Maps class labels to color names

  • color_to_class: Maps color names to class labels

Return type:

Dictionary with

marvis.utils.resource_manager.prepare_cifar_dataset(dataset_type: str = 'cifar10', force_redownload: bool = False) → tuple[source]

Convenience function to prepare CIFAR datasets using unified management.

Parameters:

  • dataset_type cifar10 or cifar100

  • force_redownload Force re-download even if dataset exists

Returns:

Tuple of (train_paths, train_labels, test_paths, test_labels, class_names)

Results Management

Unified Results Management System for MARVIS

This module provides centralized, consistent results storage across all modalities (tabular, audio, vision). Integrates with the existing resource manager to provide standardized directory structures, file naming conventions, and metadata handling.

Key features: - Consistent directory structure: <base_output_dir>/<modality>/<dataset_id>/<model_name>/ - Standardized file formats with comprehensive metadata - Modality-specific artifact support (visualizations, audio files, etc.) - Integration with existing resource manager - Backward compatibility with existing scripts - Thread-safe operations for concurrent evaluations

Usage examples:

# Basic usage results_manager = get_results_manager() results_manager.save_evaluation_results(

model_name=tabllm, dataset_id=adult, modality=tabular, results=evaluation_results, experiment_metadata=experiment_config

)

# With artifacts results_manager.save_evaluation_results(

model_name=marvis_tsne, dataset_id=cifar10, modality=vision, results=evaluation_results, artifacts={

visualizations: [tsne_plot.png, knn_plot.png], raw_responses: vlm_responses.json

}

)

# Load previous results previous_results = results_manager.load_evaluation_results(

model_name=jolt, dataset_id=diabetes, modality=tabular

)

class marvis.utils.results_manager.ExperimentMetadata(model_name: str, dataset_id: str, modality: str, timestamp: str = <factory>, num_samples_train: int | None = None, num_samples_test: int | None = None, num_features: int | None = None, num_classes: int | None = None, class_names: ~typing.List[str] | None = None, task_type: str | None = None, model_config: ~typing.Dict[str, ~typing.Any] | None = None, hyperparameters: ~typing.Dict[str, ~typing.Any] | None = None, random_seed: int | None = None, k_shot: int | None = None, use_wandb: bool = False, wandb_run_id: str | None = None, device: str | None = None, training_time_seconds: float | None = None, evaluation_time_seconds: float | None = None, memory_usage_mb: float | None = None, marvis_version: str | None = None, python_version: str | None = None, dependencies: ~typing.Dict[str, str] | None = None, notes: str | None = None, tags: ~typing.List[str] | None = None)[source]

VLM Integration

Unified VLM prompting utilities for MARVIS.

This module provides consistent prompting strategies across different modalities (tabular, audio, image) for Vision Language Model classification tasks.

marvis.utils.vlm_prompting.create_metadata_summary(metadata: DatasetMetadata) → str[source]

Create a concise metadata summary for VLM prompts.

Parameters:

metadata DatasetMetadata object with rich dataset information

Returns:

Formatted metadata summary for inclusion in prompts

marvis.utils.vlm_prompting.validate_and_clean_class_names(class_names: List[str]) → List[str][source]

Validate and clean class names for semantic naming.

Requirements: 1. Unique names 2. Only ASCII characters 3. Less than 30 characters per name 4. No whitespace (replace with underscores)

Parameters:

class_names List of class names to validate

Returns:

List of cleaned and validated class names

Raises:

ValueError If validation fails

marvis.utils.vlm_prompting.create_classification_prompt(class_names: List[str], modality: str = 'tabular', use_knn: bool = False, use_3d: bool = False, nn_k: int | None = None, legend_text: str | None = None, include_spectrogram: bool = False, dataset_description: str | None = None, use_semantic_names: bool = False, multi_viz_info: List[Dict[str, Any]] | None = None, dataset_metadata: str | None = None) → str[source]

Create a classification prompt for VLM based on modality and visualization type.

Parameters:

  • class_names List of class names/labels

  • modality Type of data (tabular, audio, image)

  • use_knn Whether KNN connections are shown

  • use_3d Whether 3D visualization is used

  • nn_k Number of nearest neighbors (if use_knn=True)

  • legend_text Legend text from the visualization

  • include_spectrogram Whether spectrogram is included (for audio)

  • dataset_description Optional description of the dataset/task

  • use_semantic_names Whether to use semantic class names in prompts (default: False uses Class X)

  • multi_viz_info Optional list of visualization method information for multi-viz prompts

  • dataset_metadata Optional structured metadata summary for domain context

Returns:

Formatted prompt string

marvis.utils.vlm_prompting.create_regression_prompt(target_stats: Dict[str, Any], modality: str = 'tabular', use_knn: bool = False, use_3d: bool = False, nn_k: int | None = None, legend_text: str | None = None, include_spectrogram: bool = False, dataset_description: str | None = None, multi_viz_info: List[Dict[str, Any]] | None = None, dataset_metadata: str | None = None) → str[source]

  • use_knn Whether KNN connections are shown

  • use_3d Whether 3D visualization is used

  • nn_k Number of nearest neighbors (if use_knn=True)

  • legend_text Legend text from the visualization

  • include_spectrogram Whether spectrogram is included (for audio)

  • dataset_description Optional description of the dataset/task

  • multi_viz_info Optional list of visualization method information for multi-viz prompts

marvis.utils.vlm_prompting.parse_vlm_response(response: str, unique_classes: List = None, logger_instance: Logger | None = None, use_semantic_names: bool = False, task_type: str = 'classification', target_stats: Dict | None = None, color_to_class_map: Dict | None = None) → Any[source]

Parse VLM response to extract the predicted class or value.

Parameters:

  • response Raw VLM response string

  • unique_classes List of valid class labels (for classification)

  • logger_instance Logger for debugging

  • use_semantic_names Whether semantic names were used in the prompt

  • task_type classification or regression

  • target_stats Statistics about target variable (for regression)

  • color_to_class_map Optional mapping from color names to class labels (e.g., {Blue: 0, Color_111: 5})

Returns:

Predicted class (for classification) or numerical value (for regression)

Model Loading

Centralized model loading system with support for both standard transformers and VLLM backends.

This module provides a unified interface for loading and using LLMs and VLMs, automatically choosing the optimal backend (VLLM for speed when available, transformers as fallback) based on model type and availability.

class marvis.utils.model_loader.GenerationConfig(max_new_tokens: int = 100, temperature: float = 0.1, top_p: float = 0.9, top_k: int = 50, do_sample: bool = True, repetition_penalty: float = 1.0, stop_tokens: List[str] | None = None, thinking_budget: int | None = None, enable_thinking: bool = True, thinking_summary: bool = False, audio_output: bool = False, response_format: str | None = None)[source]

Metadata Handling

Metadata loading and management for MARVIS datasets.

This module provides utilities for loading and managing dataset metadata to enhance VLM prompts with rich contextual information.

Detect metadata file for a dataset ID using recursive search.

Parameters:

dataset_id Dataset identifier (e.g., task ID, dataset name)

Returns:

Path to metadata file if found, None otherwise

load_metadata(dataset_id: str | int | Path | Dict[str, Any], use_cache: bool = True) → DatasetMetadata | None[source]

Load dataset metadata from various sources.

Parameters:

  • dataset_id Can be: - String/int: Dataset ID to auto-detect file - Path: Direct path to metadata file - Dict: Metadata dictionary to convert

  • use_cache Whether to use cached results

Returns:

DatasetMetadata object if successful, None otherwise

get_available_datasets() → List[str][source]

Get list of datasets with available metadata (recursive search).

Returns:

List of dataset IDs that have metadata files

Clear the metadata cache.

Try to extract a dataset ID from a file path.

Returns:

Evaluation Utilities

Shared argument parsing utilities for MARVIS evaluation scripts.

This module provides common argument parsing functions to avoid code duplication between evaluation scripts and make the main evaluation logic more focused.

marvis.utils.evaluation_args.add_model_args(parser: ArgumentParser)[source]

Add model-related arguments for evaluation.
